required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hand Rehabilitation Using Botulinum Toxin and Functional Electrical Stimulation-pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Hand Rehabilitation Using Botulinum Toxin and Functional Electrical Stimulation Among Stroke Patients With Limitation of Finger Extension Due to Spasticity- Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator tried to find out possibility of functional improvement using botulinum toxin injection targeting finger flexor spasticity with functional electrical stimulation among chronic stroke patients who did not show any improvement in hand function.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Box and Block test
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: number of box moved by affected upper extremity

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Action Research Arm Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Score of Action Research Arm Test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Medical research council grading of muscle strength

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Modified ashworth scale of finger flexor

secondary_outcome.measure: active range of motion of wrist joint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: active range of motion of wrist joint

secondary_outcome.measure: Brunnstrom stage of stroke recovery of distal upper extremity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Brunnstrom stage of stroke recovery of distal upper extremity. By observing the pattern of participants posture, the stage was scored. The stage ranges from 1 to 6. Higher is better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance from middle finger tip to mid-palmar crease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Distance from middle finger tip to mid-palmar crease

secondary_outcome.measure: Repeated number of finger extension and flexion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Repeated number of finger extension and flexion

secondary_outcome.measure: Quick Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder & Hand
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Quick Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder & Hand is questionnaire about patients' symptoms as well as ability to perform certain activities in the last week. Total score is obtained by summing the each question, and ranges from 0 (no disability) to 100 (most severe disability).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Grading of active thumb opposition. It is measured by observing the pattern of thumb opposition.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 6 weeks after baseline, 10 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Active finger extension. It is graded by observation of voluntary finger extension.

arm_group.description: Botulinum toxin type A injection followed by functional electrical stimulation

intervention.description: Botulinum toxin type A injection followed by functional electrical stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age over 18 years
- hemiplegic upper limb spasticity secondary to a unilateral ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke
- fingers and wrist flexor spasticity graded at least 1+ on the Modified Ashworth Scale
- at least 6 months since stroke
Exclusion Criteria:
- fixed contracture
- previous treatment of the upper limb spasticity with neurolytic or surgical procedure
- treatment with botulinum toxin type A in the previous 4 months
- any active device implant
- any neurological disorder, other than stroke causing motor deficits or spasticity
- inability to attend to and/or to cooperate with all outcome measure-related task secondary to cognitive impairment or aphasia
- pregnancy, planned pregnancy, or lactation
- contraindication to botulinum toxin type A

responsible_party.investigator_title: Team manager of Department of Neurorehabilitation
